org.gradoop.temporal.model.impl.operators.aggregation.functions

Class AverageDuration

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gradoop.flink.model.impl.operators.aggregation.functions.BaseAggregateFunction
      • org.gradoop.temporal.model.impl.operators.aggregation.functions.AbstractDurationAggregateFunction
        • org.gradoop.temporal.model.impl.operators.aggregation.functions.AverageDuration
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, AggregateFunction, Average, TemporalAggregateFunction
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AverageEdgeDuration, AverageVertexDuration

    public class AverageDuration
extends AbstractDurationAggregateFunction
implements Average, TemporalAggregateFunction
    Calculate the average duration of a time dimension of one given TimeDimension of temporal elements. Time intervals with either the start or end time set to the respective default value will be ignored.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • AverageDuration

        public AverageDuration(String aggregatePropertyKey,
                       TimeDimension dimension,
                       TemporalUnit unit)
        Creates a new instance of this aggregate function.
        Parameters:
        aggregatePropertyKey - the property key of the new property where the aggregated value is stored
        dimension - the time dimension to consider
        unit - the temporal unit into which the result is converted. The supported units are specified in AbstractDurationAggregateFunction.SUPPORTED_UNITS.

      • AverageDuration

        public AverageDuration(String aggregatePropertyKey,
                       TimeDimension dimension)
        Create an instance of the AverageDuration aggregate function.

        dimension - the time dimension to consider

      • AverageDuration

        public AverageDuration(TimeDimension dimension,
                       TemporalUnit unit)
        Creates a new instance of this aggregate function. The the property key of the new property, where the aggregated value is stored, will be defined as "avgDuration_" + {dimension} + "_" + {unit}. Use constructor AverageDuration(String, TimeDimension, TemporalUnit) to specify a user-defined key.
        Parameters:
        dimension - the time dimension to consider
        unit - the temporal unit into which the result is converted. The supported units are specified in AbstractDurationAggregateFunction.SUPPORTED_UNITS.

    • Method Detail

      • getIncrement

        public PropertyValue getIncrement(TemporalElement element)
        Get the duration of a time dimension as the aggregate value from a temporal element. The duration will be returned in a format used by the Average aggregation. The increment will be ignored, if the start of the end time of the time dimension is set to a default value.
        Specified by:
        getIncrement in interface TemporalAggregateFunction
        Parameters:
        element - The temporal element.
        Returns:
        The duration of the time dimension, in the internal representation used by Average.
        See Also:
        about this method.

      • postAggregate

        public PropertyValue postAggregate(PropertyValue result)
                            throws UnsupportedTypeException
        After calling Average.postAggregate(PropertyValue), this function transforms the resulting aggregate value to the specified temporal unit.
        Specified by:
        postAggregate in interface AggregateFunction
        Specified by:
        postAggregate in interface Average
        Parameters:
        result - the result of the AverageDuration aggregation as Double in milliseconds, or null if nothing was aggregated.
        Returns:
        By default (no time unit or the default unit [millis] is specified), the result of the AverageDuration aggregation as Double in milliseconds is returned. If a different temporal unit is given in AbstractDurationAggregateFunction.timeUnit, a Double of the desired unit is returned.
        Throws:
        UnsupportedTypeException - if the type of the given property value is different from Double or null.
        See Also:
        Average.postAggregate(PropertyValue)

      • toString

        public String toString()

        toString in class Object
